description: Four second year students give their advice on starting uni to this year's freshers.
title: What I wish I'd known: Four students on life as a fresher

description: The arrest of Tyler Robinson, the suspected killer of Charlie Kirk, and pressure on Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer leads Saturday's papers.
title: The Papers: 'Got him' and MPs warn Starmer 'time is running out'

description: Phil Salt has set his sights on becoming the "best in the world" as a T20 opener after smashing a record-breaking century in England's 146-run victory over South Africa.
title: Record breaker Salt wants to be world's best

description: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says he hasn't seen either Raheem Sterling or Axel Disasi since the season began and they will remain in the "bomb squad".
title: Maresca 'hasn't seen Sterling or Disasi since start of season'

description: Phil Salt hits 141 while Jos Buttler adds 83 as England score 304-2 - their highest ever total in a T20 international - before bowling South Africa out for 158, to ease to an historic win at Old Trafford in the second T20 and level the series at 1-1.
title: Record-breaking Salt helps England to historic win against South Africa

description: The government has been urged to "act fast" to protect hundreds of jobs following the cyber attack.
title: JLR suppliers 'face bankruptcy' due to hack crisis

description: Phil Salt scores England's fastest T20 century on a record-breaking night at Old Trafford as the hosts level the series with an 146-run win over South Africa.
title: Century for Salt on record-breaking night for England

description: Its decision comes as the industry says there is a lack of government investment and as the US pressures firms to invest there.

description: Christopher Joell-Deshields was suspended earlier this month after financial misconduct allegations.
title: Suspended London Pride boss ordered to hand back bank accounts

description: A shredded Terence Crawford - jumping up two divisions - weighed the same as champion Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez for Saturday's Las Vegas super-fight.
title: Ripped Crawford weighs same as champion Canelo

description: The deployment of the National Guard to Memphis comes roughly a month after he sent troops to Washington DC.

description: Cameron Norrie survives a scare against world number 545 Tomasz Berkieta to give Great Britain a 1-0 lead over Poland in the Davis Cup.

description: Seen as a martyr in the struggle against white-minority rule, Steve Biko died in police custody in 1977.

description: Brendan Rodgers calls for a club investigation to uncover the "cowardly" insider who briefed against the Celtic boss to a national newspaper.

description: Inscriptions found engraved on casings recovered with the rifle included "hey fascist! catch!"

description: Baroness Doreen Lawrence says she was "floored" by the allegation the Daily Mail was spying on her.

description: In Bilozerske, eastern Ukraine, people must make the agonising decision to flee or risk staying.

description: Kirk's loyalty towards the first family put him at the very centre of Donald Trump's Maga movement.

description: Brazil's Alice Pereira, 19, is set to become the youngest woman in history to fight in the UFC when she faces Montserrat Rendon at UFC Noche on Saturday.

description: The governor said a family member told investigators that the suspect had become "more political" in recent years.

description: Altay Bayindir will retain his place in goal for Manchester United in Sunday's derby against City - but head coach Ruben Amorim says Senne Lammens could be first choice "for a number of years".

description: Everton boss David Moyes says Jack Grealish's Premier League's player of the month for August is "just the start" for the winger.

description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says "everyone will be involved" this season as he weighs up his starting goalkeeper for Sunday's derby against Manchester United.

description: Cricket must "look at the schedule" of a "relentless" calendar, with some players "exhausted", says ECB chairman Richard Thompson.

description: Lord Mandelson sacked just a few days after Rayner resignation and cabinet reshuffle.

description: The Reform leader is facing questions about how his partner could afford to buy the house in his constituency.

description: The Brazilian ex-president has been sentenced to 27 years for plotting a coup, but an amnesty could be on the cards.

description: Jay Wynne joined BBC Weather in October 2000 and was a regular forecaster on BBC News at Ten.

description: The Netherlands follows Ireland in saying it can "no longer justify Israel's inclusion" in the event.

description: England captain Zoe Aldcroft has recovered from injury start the Red Roses' Women's Rugby World Cup quarter-final against Scotland on Sunday in Bristol.

description: A sheriff orders the three members of a self-styled "African tribe" to be removed from privately-owned land in the Scottish Borders.

description: MPs in the Commons backed the Terminally Ill Adults Bill by a majority of 23 in June this year.

description: Great Britain's Davis Cup tie in Poland feels like a Premier League side being drawn away to a non-league team in the third round of the FA Cup - but it's one they must win, writes Russell Fuller.

description: Wayne Rooney has been involved in plenty of Manchester derby moments - both good and bad - and he discusses them in his BBC podcast.
